content: Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
Right now the fire tower is almost useless, either increase the damage or reduce the cooldown time. And 100-250 lives should suffice.

The number of lives does not matter that much in play. I would expect the default bot (which does really nothing) to die during the game. Either lower the number of lives or increase the number of lemmings.

Bug: some shots are displayed at invalid positions, e.g. https://i.snipboard.io/BVtR6A.jpg

Upgrades are not affecting the tooltips

it would be useful to show the total gold collected (or spent), next to the remaining gold and lives. This can help keep track of who's ahead especially in the early/mid stages.
The stub fails to compile in languages where "type" is a keyword (Rust, OCaml, ...).

Great.
In description "BUILD id type" is wrong to upgrade, "UPGRADE id type" works fine.

Funny little game slightly remnant of lemmings but the statement is unreadable. Consider adding separators, blank lines. The PASS action is not documented. Graphics definitely need to be improved.
UPDATE: the statement.html looks OK in Firefox but is obviously having a hard time within CG

Gonna leave this as a different comment:

Crashing gives you the win against the default AI.

The default stub does not include a print statement. It would be helpful for newer players to see and example of a command they can give directly in the code. Plus, adding it would make this multi consistent with every other one.

Same issue for Python. Specifically, "range" is used in Python's for-loop as a function. This causes a crash on turn 2 as range is now an integer rather than a function.

"reload" is also a built-in function that gets clobbered but it shouldn't cause any issues.

I'm aware of the display bug...
When I create a new sprite and place it in a group, it will only be added to the group at the end of the turn (or when I commit it manually)

I outcommented the tooltips for testing (also affects creep tooltips), as replays doubled the size to 1MB. I guess I have to write my own tooltip module to get some compression.

To be honest I'm still not sure if I will finish coding the game. The biggest TODOs are graphics and balancing.
I plan to set it to 10. But for now I want longer battles for easier testing.

I'm sure we will find a value i between that satisfies all of us. It should be significantly lower than the possible number of attackers, so a player can actually die.
For now I see more important tasks in the UI design to address first.

I admit I haven't done much testing on the balancing yet, but placing a fire tower close to the opponent spawn point should deal some notable damage to larger groups of attackers.
I've done some testing, and I confirm that the fire tower IS useful with the later, more dense waves.
At 10, the games would be incredibly short, and the effectiveness of the heal tower and the glue tower reduced, as long term strategies would give way to short term.
I renamed range in github, will be fixed when euler reuploads the game.
